definition: Garden of Many Flowers (name)/Baihua garden in Hongmiao village 洪廟村|洪庙村[Hong2 miao4 cun1], Shandong
flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful
land used for growing plants/site used for public recreation/abbr. for a place ending in 園|园, such as a botanical garden 植物園|植物园, kindergarten 幼兒園|幼儿园 etc

sentences.english: Poetry prophecy is an exotic flower in remote mountains which is in full bloom in our Chinese classics hundred-flower garden.
sentences.chinese: 詩讖是盛開在中國古典文學百花園裏的一株深山奇葩。

sentences.english: In this blooming cultural park much more can be expected for the French public.
sentences.chinese: 對這個文化百花園，法國公衆可以有多種期待。

sentences.english: Russian culture is of great significance in the world.
sentences.chinese: 俄羅斯文化是世界百花園中的一枝奇葩。

sentences.english: Only by so doing will various civilizations in the world blossom with radiant splendor.
sentences.chinese: 這樣，世界文明的百花園才能異彩紛呈。

sentences.english: Contemporary Chinese Prairie literature is a wonderful work in the world's 100 Prairie Gardens.
sentences.chinese: 當代中國草原文學是世界百花園中的一朵奇葩。

sentences.english: In this blooming cultural park much more can be expected for the French public. As Mr.
sentences.chinese: 對這個文化百花園，法國公衆可以有多種期待。

definition: (bird species of China) grey heron (Ardea cinerea)
fig. beautiful purples and brilliant reds (idiom); lit. beautiful flowers
to drift/to wave/to float on the waves/to flutter in the wind
lit. paper has become expensive in Luoyang (because everyone is making a copy of a popular story) (idiom)/fig. (of a product) to sell like hotcakes
to ride the dragon/to die (of emperors and kings)
